summary:
Here is a final summary of the Universal Credit Act 2025:

*   **Purpose:** The Universal Credit Act 2025 primarily aims to restructure Universal Credit and Employment and Support Allowance rates, mandating specific annual increases for the UC standard allowance and introducing new frameworks for the Limited Capability for Work and Work-Related Activity (LCWRA) element.
*   **Definitions:** Key new definitions include "pre-2026 claimants" (those continuously receiving LCWRA before April 6, 2026) and "Severe Conditions Criteria (SCC) claimants," characterized by specific lifelong, professionally diagnosed conditions meeting Schedule 7 descriptors. The "relevant CPI percentage" for up-rating is based on the September Consumer Prices Index.
*   **Eligibility:** Eligibility for LCWRA will now be tiered, with a new, lower amount for claimants not categorized as "pre-2026," "SCC," or "terminally ill." SCC claimants must demonstrate a lifelong, constant, professionally diagnosed condition fulfilling specific criteria.
*   **Obligations:** The Act mandates annual increases for the Universal Credit standard allowance and the combined protected LCWRA/standard allowance (based on CPI and uplift percentages) for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30. Similar CPI-based up-rating applies to specific legacy ESA components, while the annual up-rating of LCWRA and LCW elements is generally frozen during this period. These obligations apply to both Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
*   **Enforcement & Assessments:** New assessment rules for SCC claimants limit further reviews once a determination is made, unless "relevant evidence" (e.g., material factual error, significant change) is presented. The Act also suspends general annual up-rating provisions for certain components, with all these changes taking effect from April 6, 2026.

sections.definitions:
The Act defines the following terms:
- **consumer prices index**: the all items consumer prices index published by the Statistics Board. (Section 1(6)(a), Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(a), Section 4(4)(b), Schedule 2 Para 3(4)(b))
- **relevant power (UK)**: (i) the power in section 9(2) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012, or (ii) the power in section 150(2)(b) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992. (Section 1(6)(b))
- **relevant power (Northern Ireland)**: (i) the power in Article 14(2) of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015 (S.I. 2015/2006 (N.I. 1)); (ii) the power in section 132 of the Social Security Administration (Northern Ireland) Act 1992. (Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(b))
- **standard allowance (UK)**: the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under section 9(1) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012. (Section 1(6)(c), Section 4(3)(c))
- **standard allowance (Northern Ireland)**: the allowance to be included in an award of universal credit under Article 14(1) of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015. (Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(c), Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(c))
- **standard allowance for a tax year (UK)**: the standard allowance applicable for any assessment period commencing on or after the first Monday of that tax year and before the first Monday of the following tax year. (Section 1(6)(d))
- **standard allowance for a tax year (Northern Ireland)**: the standard allowance applicable for any assessment period commencing on or after the first Monday of that tax year and before the first Monday of the following tax year. (Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(d))
- **assessment period (UK)**: has the same meaning as in Part 1 of the Welfare Reform Act 2012. (Section 1(6)(d), Section 2(3), Section 4(3)(d))
- **assessment period (Northern Ireland)**: has the same meaning as in Part 2 of the Welfare Reform (Northern Ireland) Order 2015. (Schedule 2 Para 1(5)(d), Schedule 2 Para 2(10), Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(d))
- **tax year**: the 12 months beginning with 6 April in any year. (Section 1(7)(a), Schedule 2 Para 1(6)(a))
- **tax year 2025-26**: the tax year beginning on 6 April 2025 (and any corresponding expression in which two years are similarly mentioned is to be read in the same way). (Section 1(7)(b), Schedule 2 Para 1(6)(b))
- **relevant CPI percentage for a tax year**: the percentage by which the consumer prices index for the September before the start of the tax year is higher than it was for the September before that (or 0% if it is not higher). (Section 1(3), Section 4(4)(a), Schedule 2 Para 1(3), Schedule 2 Para 3(4)(a))
- **LCWRA element (UK)**: has the meaning given by regulation 27 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013. (Section 3(2)(a), Section 4(3)(b))
- **LCWRA element (Northern Ireland)**: has the meaning given by regulation 28 of the Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016. (Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(b))
- **LCW element (UK)**: has the meaning given by regulation 27 of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013 (so far as saved by paragraph 8 of Schedule 2 to the Employment and Support Allowance and Universal Credit (Miscellaneous Amendments and Transitional and Savings Provisions) Regulations 2017). (Section 3(2)(b))
- **protected LCWRA amount (UK)**: the amount of the LCWRA element that applies to a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant or a claimant who is terminally ill (within the meanings of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013). (Section 4(3)(a))
- **protected LCWRA amount (Northern Ireland)**: the amount of the LCWRA element that applies to a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant or a claimant who is terminally ill (within the meanings of the Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016). (Schedule 2 Para 3(3)(a))
- **amount of the ESA IR personal allowance (UK)**: an amount (i) that is prescribed under section 4(2)(a) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007 (amount of income-related allowance), and (ii) that is not an amount of a premium specified in Part 3 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008 or an amount in respect of housing costs. (Section 5(5)(a))
- **amount of the ESA IR personal allowance (Northern Ireland)**: an amount (i) that is prescribed under section 4(2)(a) of the Welfare Reform Act (Northern Ireland) 2007 (amount of income-related allowance), and (ii) that is not an amount of a premium specified in Part 3 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 (S.R. (N.I.) 2008 No. 280) or an amount in respect of housing costs. (Schedule 2 Para 4(4)(a))
- **amount of an ESA IR disability premium (UK)**: an amount of the severe disability premium or enhanced disability premium specified in Part 3 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008, so far as prescribed under section 4(2)(a) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007. (Section 5(5)(b))
- **ESA IR support component (UK)**: the amount specified in paragraph 13 of Part 4 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008, so far as specified under section 4(6)(c) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007. (Section 5(5)(c))
- **ESA IR work-related activity component (UK)**: the amount specified in paragraph 12 of Part 4 of Schedule 4 to the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008, so far as specified under section 4(6)(c) of the Welfare Reform Act 2007 for the purposes of cases falling within paragraphs 2 to 7 of Schedule 2 to the Employment and Support Allowance and Universal Credit (Miscellaneous Amendments and Transitional and Savings Provisions) Regulations 2017. (Section 5(5)(d))
- **reference to an amount or component for a tax year (UK)**: the amount applicable for any benefit week commencing on or after the first Monday of that tax year and before the first Monday of the following tax year. (Section 5(5)(e))
- **reference to an amount for a tax year (Northern Ireland)**: the amount applicable for any benefit week commencing on or after the first Monday of that tax year and before the first Monday of the following tax year. (Schedule 2 Para 4(4)(b))
- **benefit week (UK)**: has the same meaning as in the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations 2008. (Section 5(5)(e))
- **benefit week (Northern Ireland)**: has the same meaning as in the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008. (Schedule 2 Para 4(4)(b))
- **pre-2026 claimant (UK)**: has the meaning in regulation 27A(1) of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013. (Schedule 1 Para 2)
- **pre-2026 claimant (Northern Ireland)**: has the meaning in regulation 28A(1) of the Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016. (Schedule 2 Para 2(2))
- **severe conditions criteria claimant (UK)**: has the meaning in regulation 40A(2) of the Universal Credit Regulations 2013. (Schedule 1 Para 2)
- **severe conditions criteria claimant (Northern Ireland)**: has the meaning in regulation 41A(2) of the Universal Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2016. (Schedule 2 Para 2(2))
- **descriptor constantly applies to a claimant (UK)**: if that descriptor applies to the claimant at all times or, as the case may be, on all occasions on which the claimant undertakes or attempts to undertake the activity described by that descriptor. (Schedule 1 Para 6(4))
- **descriptor constantly applies to a claimant (Northern Ireland)**: if that descriptor applies to the claimant at all times or, as the case may be, on all occasions on which the claimant undertakes or attempts to undertake the activity described by that descriptor. (Schedule 2 Para 2(6)(4))
- **NHS services**: health care services provided for the purposes of the health service continued under (i) section 1(1) of the National Health Service Act 2006; (ii) section 1(1) of the National Health Service (Wales) Act 2006; (iii) section 1(1) of the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978; (b) health and social care within the meaning of the Health and Social Care (Reform) Act (Northern Ireland) 2009 provided for the purposes of the system promoted under section 2(1) of that Act. (Schedule 1 Para 6(5))
- **health and social care services (Northern Ireland)**: (a) health and social care within the meaning of the Health and Social Care (Reform) Act (Northern Ireland) 2009 provided for the purposes of the system promoted under section 2(1) of that Act; (b) health care services provided for the purposes of the health service continued under (i) section 1(1) of the National Health Service Act 2006; (ii) section 1(1) of the National Health Service (Wales) Act 2006; (iii) section 1(1) of the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978. (Schedule 2 Para 2(6)(5))
- **relevant evidence**: evidence to suggest that (a) the determination was made in ignorance of, or based on a mistake as to, some material fact, or (b) there has been a relevant change of circumstances in relation to the claimant's physical or mental condition. (Schedule 1 Para 7(6), Schedule 2 Para 2(7)(6))
sections.obligations:
The Act outlines the following obligations:
- **Secretary of State (UK)**: Must exercise a relevant power to secure that the standard allowance amounts for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the calculated minimum amounts. (Section 1(1))
- **Secretary of State (UK)**: Must exercise power to increase the protected LCWRA amount or standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, if necessary to achieve the specified result. (Section 4(1))
- **Secretary of State (UK)**: Must exercise power to increase ESA IR disability premium, ESA IR support component, or ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, if necessary to achieve the specified result. (Section 5(3))
- **Department for Communities in Northern Ireland**: Must exercise a relevant power to secure that the standard allowance amounts for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the calculated minimum amounts. (Schedule 2 Para 1(1))
- **Department for Communities in Northern Ireland**: Must exercise power to increase the protected LCWRA amount or standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, if necessary to achieve the specified result. (Schedule 2 Para 3(1))
- **Department for Communities in Northern Ireland**: Must exercise power to increase ESA IR disability premium, ESA IR support component, or ESA IR personal allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, if necessary to achieve the specified result. (Schedule 2 Para 4(2))
- **Annual up-rating of benefits (UK)**: Subsections (1) and (2) of section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 do not apply to the standard allowance, LCWRA element, LCW element, ESA IR disability premium, ESA IR support component, or ESA IR work-related activity component for specified tax years (ending with 5 April 2026, 2027, 2028, and 2029). (Section 1(5), Section 3(1), Section 5(2))
- **Assessments (UK & Northern Ireland)**: No further assessment for limited capability for work or severe conditions criteria is to be carried out unless there is relevant evidence, if a previous determination has been made. (Schedule 1 Para 7(4), (5); Schedule 2 Para 2(7)(4), (5))
- **Medical Examination (UK & Northern Ireland)**: Claimants may be required to undergo a medical examination to determine limited capability for work and work-related activity or severe conditions criteria. (Schedule 1 Para 9; Schedule 2 Para 2(9))
sections.responsibilities:
The Act assigns the following responsibilities:
- **Secretary of State (UK)**: Responsible for securing minimum standard allowance amounts and increasing protected LCWRA amounts, standard allowances, and legacy ESA payments as required by the Act. (Section 1(1), Section 4(1), Section 5(3))
- **Department for Communities in Northern Ireland**: Responsible for securing minimum standard allowance amounts and increasing protected LCWRA amounts, standard allowances, and legacy ESA payments in Northern Ireland as required by the Act. (Schedule 2 Para 1(1), Schedule 2 Para 3(1), Schedule 2 Para 4(2))
sections.eligibility:
The Act sets out the following eligibility criteria:
- **LCWRA element (UK & Northern Ireland)**: Awarded based on whether the claimant is a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant, terminally ill, or any other claimant. (Schedule 1 Para 3(a); Schedule 2 Para 2(3)(a))
- **Pre-2026 claimant (UK & Northern Ireland)**: A claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity who (a) was entitled at any time before 6 April 2026 to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element, and (b) has been continuously entitled to such an award from that time. (Schedule 1 Para 4(1); Schedule 2 Para 2(4)(1))
- **Continuous entitlement (UK & Northern Ireland)**: For determining continuous entitlement, no account is taken of any period of non-entitlement (up to six months) that begins because the financial condition in section 5(1)(b) or (2)(b) of the Act (or Article 10(1)(b) or (2)(b) of the Order for NI) ceases to be met. (Schedule 1 Para 4(2); Schedule 2 Para 2(4)(2))
- **Severe conditions criteria claimant (UK & Northern Ireland)**: A claimant is a severe conditions criteria claimant if it has been determined on the basis of an assessment that (a) the claimant has limited capability for work and work-related activity, and (b) at least one of the descriptors set out in Schedule 7 constantly applies to the claimant and will do so for the rest of the claimant’s life. (Schedule 1 Para 6(1), (2); Schedule 2 Para 2(6)(1), (2))
- **Conditions for incapability (UK)**: Incapability must arise from specific bodily disease/disablement (descriptors 1-8, 15(a), 15(b), 16(a), 16(b)) or specific mental illness/disablement (descriptors 9-14, 15(c), 15(d), 16(c), 16(d)) that is lifelong and has been diagnosed by an appropriately qualified health care professional in the course of providing NHS services. (Schedule 1 Para 6(3))
- **Conditions for incapability (Northern Ireland)**: Incapability must arise from specific bodily disease/disablement (descriptors 1-8, 15(a), 15(b), 16(a), 16(b)) or specific mental illness/disablement (descriptors 9-14, 15(c), 15(d), 16(c), 16(d)) that is lifelong and has been diagnosed by an appropriately qualified health care professional in the course of providing health and social care services. (Schedule 2 Para 2(6)(3))
- **Further assessment conditions (UK & Northern Ireland)**: Further assessments are only carried out if there is 'relevant evidence' following a previous determination regarding limited capability for work or severe conditions criteria. (Schedule 1 Para 7(4), (5); Schedule 2 Para 2(7)(4), (5))
sections.payments:
The Act makes provisions for the following payments:
- **Standard allowance calculation (UK & Northern Ireland)**: Minimum amounts for a tax year are calculated by taking the previous year's amounts, increasing by the relevant CPI percentage, then increasing by the relevant uplift percentage. (Section 1(2); Schedule 2 Para 1(2))
- **Relevant uplift percentage (UK & Northern Ireland)**:
    - 2026-27: 2.3%
    - 2027-28: 3.1%
    - 2028-29: 4.0%
    - 2029-30: 4.8% (Section 1(4); Schedule 2 Para 1(4))
- **LCWRA element amount (UK & Northern Ireland)**: £217.26 for claimants with limited capability for work and work-related activity, other than a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant or a claimant who is terminally ill. (Section 2(1)(a); Schedule 2 Para 2(5)(a))
- **LCWRA element for joint claimants (UK & Northern Ireland)**: Where the LCWRA element for each joint claimant is a different amount, the higher amount is to be included in the award. (Schedule 1 Para 3(c); Schedule 2 Para 2(3)(c))
- **Protected LCWRA amount calculation (UK & Northern Ireland)**: The sum of the protected LCWRA amount and a standard allowance amount for the current tax year must be at least the sum of those amounts for the previous tax year, increased by the relevant CPI percentage. (Section 4(2); Schedule 2 Para 3(2))
- **Legacy ESA payments (UK)**: The calculation method for the standard allowance (Section 1) applies to the ESA IR personal allowance. Annual up-rating of benefits (Social Security Administration Act 1992, s.150) does not apply to any amount of an ESA IR disability premium, the ESA IR support component, or the ESA IR work-related activity component for tax years ending with 5 April 2026, 2027, 2028, and 2029. (Section 5(1), (2))
- **Legacy ESA payments (Northern Ireland)**: The calculation method for the standard allowance (Paragraph 1 of Schedule 2) applies to the ESA IR personal allowance. (Schedule 2 Para 4(1))
- **Legacy ESA components calculation (UK & Northern Ireland)**: The sum of ESA IR disability premium, ESA IR support component, and ESA IR personal allowance for the current tax year must be at least the sum of those amounts for the previous tax year, increased by the relevant CPI percentage. (Section 5(4); Schedule 2 Para 4(3))
sections.penalties: No explicit penalties are mentioned in the provided text.
sections.record_keeping:
The Act includes the following record-keeping requirements:
- **Information requirement (UK & Northern Ireland)**: Claimants are subject to an information requirement for the purposes of determining whether they have limited capability for work and work-related activity or are a severe conditions criteria claimant. (Schedule 1 Para 8; Schedule 2 Para 2(8))

rule_checks.evidence:
Section 1(6): 'In this section (a) consumer prices index means the all items consumer prices index published by the Statistics Board; (b) a relevant power means...; (c) the standard allowance means...; (d) the standard allowance for a tax year means...'
Section 1(7): 'In this section and sections 3 to 5 (a) tax year means the 12 months beginning with 6 April in any year; (b) tax year 2025-26 means the tax year beginning on 6 April 2025...'
Schedule 1, Regulation 2: 'In regulation 2 (interpretation), at the appropriate places insert pre-2026 claimant has the meaning in regulation 27A(1); ; severe conditions criteria claimant has the meaning in regulation 40A(2); .'

Schedule 1, Regulation 27A(1): 'For the purposes of regulation 27, a claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity is a pre-2026 claimant if the claimant (a) was entitled at any time before 6 April 2026 to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element, and (b) has been entitled to an award of universal credit that included the LCWRA element continuously from that time.'
Schedule 1, Regulation 40A(2): 'A claimant is a severe conditions criteria claimant on the basis of an assessment under this Part if (a) the claimant has limited capability for work and work-related activity on the basis of an assessment under this Part (see regulation 40(2)), and (b) at least one of the descriptors set out in Schedule 7 constantly applies to the claimant and will do so for the rest of the claimant s life.'

rule_checks.rule: Act must specify what the authority (government) must do
rule_checks.evidence:
Section 1(1): 'The Secretary of State must exercise a relevant power in order to secure that the amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the amounts calculated for each tax year in accordance with subsection (2).'
Section 4(1): 'Where it is necessary in order to achieve the result in subsection (2) for any of the tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30, the Secretary of State must exercise the power in section 9(2) or 12(3) of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 to increase...'
Schedule 2, Paragraph 1(1): 'The Department for Communities in Northern Ireland must exercise a relevant power in order to secure that the amounts of the standard allowance for tax years 2026-27 to 2029-30 are at least the amounts calculated for each tax year in accordance with sub-paragraph (2).'

rule_checks.rule: Act must list penalties or enforcement methods
rule_checks.evidence: The document focuses on setting and adjusting benefit rates and amending existing regulations. It does not contain any provisions outlining penalties, fines, or specific enforcement methods for non-compliance with its stipulations.

rule_checks.rule: Act must explain how to calculate payments
rule_checks.evidence:
Section 1(2): 'The minimum amounts of the standard allowance for a tax year are calculated as follows Step 1 Where the tax year is 2026-27, take the amounts of the standard allowance for tax year 2025-26. Where the tax year is 2027-28, 2028-29 or 2029-30, take the amounts resulting from Step 2 for the previous tax year. Step 2 Increase the amounts identified in Step 1 by the relevant CPI percentage for the tax year. Step 3 Increase the amounts resulting from Step 2 by the relevant uplift percentage for the tax year.'
Section 2(1)(a): 'before the row showing the amount for limited capability for work and work-related activity ( the existing row ) insert 217.26 ; claimant with limited capability for work and work-related activity, other than a pre-2026 claimant, a severe conditions criteria claimant or a claimant who is terminally ill'

rule_checks.evidence:
Schedule 1, Regulation 43: 'In regulation 43 (information requirement) (a) in paragraph (1), in the opening words, after activity insert or is a severe conditions criteria claimant ; (b) in paragraph (3), for , as the case may be, for work and work-related activity substitute for work and work-related activity or as not being a severe conditions criteria claimant (as the case may be) .'
This section amends an existing 'information requirement' regulation, thereby extending its scope to the new claimant categories defined by this Act.
